channel.title: Loving my tummy
channel.description: Recent content on Loving my tummy

item.title: About
item.description: The first collection of healthy real-world recipes synthetized by Artificial Intelligence! What? Some facts about this project: Original recipes are gathered from real-world restaurants, shows, instagramers, youtubers,… The resulting dishes are generated by using cutting-edge AI technology. AI tools: ideogram, Bing image generator, ChatGPT. Every recipe credits its original creator, showcasing the original dish and providing a direct link to the source. All recipes have been tested by cooking them.

item.title: Tips and notes
item.description: To sweeten recipes, it’s better to use crushed dates or pure honey instead of sugar or artificial sweeteners. Almost all oven recipes can also be made in the air fryer. When I specify olive oil I mean always extra virgin olive oil (AOVE). Cutting fresh herbs: Cutting fresh herbs should be done with a very sharp knife, taking all the time needed to ensure they are sliced, not crushed. Ideally, you want the knife to glide over the cutting board rather than mash the herbs.

item.title: Apple & fresh cheese parfait
item.description: Peel and very finely slice the green apples. Sauté them in a pan with the butter, ginger, and cinnamon for 8–10 minutes, stirring occasionally. In a bowl, mix the fresh cheese (quark or similar) with the vanilla extract, ground chia seeds, and rolled oats. In a glass container, alternate layers of warm apple with the cheese mixture. Top with frozen raspberries and serve chilled or slightly warm.

item.title: Apple cinnamon oatmeal cookies
item.description: Peel and chop finely the apples (0.5 cm cubes or smaller). Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) degrees. Line two 45x30 cm baking sheets with silicone baking mats or parchment paper. In a mixing bowl whisk together flour, oats, cinnamon, baking soda and salt for 20 seconds, set aside. In the bowl of an electric stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment cream together butter and brown sugar until combined. Mix in egg and vanilla extract.

item.title: Apple turnovers
item.description: Preheat the oven to 200°C (390°F). Peel the apples, cut them into small cubes, and sauté them in a pan over medium heat for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally with the sugar (optional) and butter until they are slightly caramelized. Add the cinnamon and mix. Let it cool. Fill the pastry discs with the apple mixture and fold them, sealing the edges with the help of a fork. Place the turnovers on a baking sheet and optionally brush them with a little sunflower oil or egg using a pastry brush.

item.title: Bacon cheeseburger
item.description: Prepare the bacon: Heat a skillet over medium heat. Cook the bacon slices until crispy, about 4-5 minutes per side. Remove and place on paper towels to drain excess grease. Form the burger patty: Shape the ground beef into a round patty, slightly larger than the bun. Press a small indent in the center with your thumb. Season both sides with salt and pepper. Cook the patty: Heat a grill or skillet over medium-high heat.

item.title: Banana ice cream
item.description: Blend the bananas with the yogurt and peanut butter in a blender. Place in the freezer for 30 minutes. Serve and add the chopped chocolate pieces. Adaptation from Instagram @miguelnaarfit.

item.title: Bangers and potatoes
item.description: Prepare the potatoes: Wash and dry the potatoes. If using baby potatoes, halve them; otherwise, cut into 1-inch chunks. Toss the potatoes in olive oil and coat evenly with the seasoning blend. Preheat the air fryer: Preheat to 200ºC (400ºF) for 3 minutes. Cook the potatoes: Place the seasoned potatoes in the air fryer basket. Cook at 200ºC (400ºF) for 10 minutes, shaking the basket halfway through. Add the sausages: After 10 minutes, add the sausages cutted in dices to the air fryer basket with the potatoes.

item.title: Baticate
item.description: 1 serving. Cut, peel and pit the avocado. We recommend cutting the avocado in half and removing the flesh with a large spoon. Cut it into chunks and place it in a bowl where you are going to beat it. Add the milk, sweetener, and cinnamon. If you want to try it with banana, now is the time to add it too. Whisk everything together (carefully so it doesn’t splash). Tips: If you find it too thick or liquid, you can correct it by adding more milk or avocado.

item.title: Bilbaina-style sea bream
item.description: Preheat the oven: Preheat to 200°C (390°F). Place the butterflied sea bream on a baking dish and bake for 15 minutes. Prepare the garlic and chili oil: While the fish is baking, heat the olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the garlic slices and cayenne peppers, and cook until the garlic turns golden. Remove from heat. Finish the sauce: Remove the sea bream from the oven. Pour the garlic-chili oil mixture on top.

item.title: Blueberries & banana crumpets
item.description: Mash the bananas, add the flour and baking powder, and knead well. Add the blueberries and continue kneading until you get a moldable dough. Divide the dough into 4 equal pieces, flatten the balls, and cook them in a covered pan over medium-low heat for 4 minutes on each side. From Instagram @recetassaludables_faciles.

item.title: Broccoli balls
item.description: Prepare the broccoli: Finely chop the raw broccoli (florets and stems if desired) using a knife or pulse in a food processor until it resembles coarse crumbs. This method retains all the nutrients and texture of the fresh broccoli. Mix the ingredients: In a large bowl, combine the chopped broccoli with the grated cheese, breadcrumbs, and eggs. Mix until a uniform dough forms. Shape the balls: With clean hands, form small, even-sized balls from the mixture.

item.title: Broccoli curry
item.description: Prepare the broccoli: Cut the broccoli into small florets. Steam or boil the broccoli florets for 3-5 minutes, until tender but still firm (1 minutes for crispy). Set aside. Sauté the aromatics: Heat a bit of oil in a large skillet or pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté for 3-4 minutes, until softened. Add the minced garlic and ground cumin, and cook for another minute, stirring constantly.

item.title: Broccoli pizza crust
item.description: This recipe is similar to Cauliflower pizza crust. Preheat the oven: Set the oven to 220°C (425°F). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or lightly grease it with oil. Prepare the broccoli: Steam the chopped broccoli (including stems if using) until tender. Pulse it in a food processor until finely grated. Transfer the grated broccoli to a cheesecloth or clean kitchen towel and squeeze out as much water as possible to ensure a dry mixture.

item.title: Bruschetta
item.description: Spread the tomato over the slices of bread. Add the spicy oil. Place one or two anchovies per slice of bread. Put them in the oven at 180°C (350°F) for 5 minutes (or until the bread is slightly toasted). From Pizzeria Papa Luigi.

item.title: Burrata salad with anchovies
item.description: Prepare the Tomatoes: Wash the tomatoes and slice them into medium-thick rounds. Arrange them decoratively on the base of a large plate or serving platter. Add the Burrata: Gently tear the burrata with your hands into irregular pieces, or carefully slice it. Place the burrata pieces over the tomato slices, distributing them evenly. Arrange the Anchovies: Lightly drain the anchovy fillets from their oil and distribute them over the burrata and tomatoes.

item.title: Cajun fries
item.description: Prepare the potatoes: Wash, dry, and cut the potato into 1/4" strips. Toss them in peanut oil until evenly coated. Air fry: Cook in an air fryer at 200°C (400°F) for 15 minutes until golden brown. Seasoning blend: Mix all the remaining ingredients into a cajun seasoning blend. Toss with spices: Toss the fries with 1/2 to 3/4 of the seasoning blend. Return them to the air fryer for 4-6 minutes at 200°C (400°F).

item.title: Carrot & Coconut balls
item.description: Cut the carrots into slices and boil them with a little water for about 20 minutes until they are soft. Drain them well and let them cool. Once they are cool, mash them well with a fork until you get a thick purée. In a bowl, mix the mashed carrots with the shredded coconut until you get a smooth mixture. Crumble magdalenas or sponge cake into the mixture, enough to give the dough some consistency so it can be formed into balls.

item.title: Carrot & Coconut cake
item.description: Grease a baking pan with a knob of butter and dust it with a bit of flour. Tap the pan to remove any excess flour. Using an electric mixer, beat the eggs with the sugar until well combined. Add the softened butter and continue mixing. Incorporate the shredded coconut and keep beating until everything is well blended. Peel and grate the carrots, then add them to the mixture, stirring with a spoon.

item.title: Carrot cake with cookie and cocoa base
item.description: Slice the carrots and boil them in a little water for about 15 minutes until soft. Drain well and let them cool. Crush the cookies into fine crumbs. Mix them with the melted butter and cocoa powder until you get a uniform dough. Press this mixture firmly into the bottom of a rectangular tray or pan to form the base. Chill in the fridge. Once the carrots are cold, mash them with a fork or blend them until you get a thick purée.

item.title: Catalan-style spinach
item.description: Hydrate the raisins: Place the raisins in a bowl with warm water and let them soak for 10-15 minutes. Drain and set aside. Cook the spinach: If using fresh spinach, wash it thoroughly and drain. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil, add the spinach, and blanch for 1-2 minutes. Drain and cool quickly under cold water. If using frozen spinach, cook according to the package instructions and drain well.

item.title: Cauliflower crumbs
item.description: For 1 serving. Wash the cauliflower thoroughly and drain to remove excess water. Coarsely chop it into approximately 1-centimeter pieces l or less. Heat a layer of extra virgin olive oil in a large pan or skillet. Sauté a clove of garlic, peeled and finely grated or minced. Before the garlic begins to brown, add the cauliflower crumbs, salt to taste, and stir. Sauté for 7-8 minutes. Optionally, add the paprika and stir.

item.title: Cauliflower pizza crust
item.description: This recipe is similar to Broccoli pizza crust. Preheat the oven: Set the oven to 220°C (425°F). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or lightly grease it with oil. Prepare the cauliflower: Pulse the cauliflower in a food processor until finely grated. Transfer the grated cauliflower to a cheesecloth or clean kitchen towel and squeeze out as much water as possible to ensure a dry mixture. Make the dough: In a bowl, mix the grated cauliflower, egg, 2 tbsp mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.

item.title: Char Siu (Chinese BBQ pork)
item.description: Prepare the Pork: Cut the pork into long strips or chunks, each about 5 to 7.5 cm thick. Avoid trimming the fat as it helps keep the pork juicy and flavorful during cooking. Make the Marinade: In a bowl, combine sugar, salt, five-spice powder, white pepper, sesame oil, Shaoxing wine, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, molasses (or dark soy), garlic, and food coloring (if using). For an extra layer of flavor, add 1 teaspoon of oyster sauce.

item.title: Chicago-style hot dog
item.description: Quantities for 1 serving. Prepare the hot dogs: Steam or boil the hot dogs according to package instructions. If you prefer a grilled flavor, you can grill them until heated through. Prepare the buns: Steam the poppy seed buns for a few minutes until soft and warm. You can use a steamer or wrap them in a damp paper towel and microwave them briefly. Assemble the hot dogs: Place each hot dog into a steamed poppy seed bun.

item.title: Chicken kebab
item.description: In a bowl, mix all the ingredients (except the pineapple) with the chicken. Let it marinate for 1 hour. Skewer the chicken onto a wooden stick. Place a layer of pineapple on a baking tray and place the skewer on top of it. Bake at 200°C (390°F) for 60-90 minutes, turning it halfway through. Scile into the chicken. Serve the chicken in pita bread or on a plate with your favourite sides.

item.title: Chicken Tikka Masala
item.description: Cook the rice. Cut the chicken breast into pieces and sauté with salt and pepper. Add the cream cheese, Greek yogurt, and a bit of tomato paste, and mix well. Add sweet or spicy paprika, garlic and onion powder, a generous amount of curry, a pinch of cumin, and food coloring (optional). Mix until it reduces slightly. From Instagram @ugar90.

item.title: Chilli lemon butter shrimp
item.description: Prepare the shrimp: If not already done, wash, peel, and devein the shrimp. Cook the aromatics: In a pan over medium heat, add the butter and olive oil. Once hot, add the garlic, diced red onion, and chilli. Sauté for about 2 minutes until fragrant. Add seasoning and lemon: Stir in the smoked paprika and chilli & lemon seasoning. Cook for another 2 minutes. Add the lemon zest and juice and mix well.

item.title: Chistorra in beer
item.description: Cook the chistorra: Heat a large frying pan over medium heat (no oil needed if the chistorra is fatty). Add the chistorra, sliced into smaller pieces (about 5-7 cm long), and cook until browned on all sides. Remove the chistorra from the pan and set it aside. Leave the rendered fat in the pan. Clean the pan: Remove any burnt bits (grass) from the pan, leaving behind the flavorful fat.

item.title: Chocolat coulant (Molten chocolate cake)
item.description: Alternative names Runny core cake Mi-cuit au chocolat Chocolate lava cake Volcano cake Preparation Preheat the oven: Preheat to 200°C (390°F). Grease four ramekins with butter and dust them with cocoa powder or flour. Set aside. Melt chocolate and butter: In a heatproof bowl, combine the chocolate and butter. Melt them over a bain-marie (double boiler) or in short intervals in the microwave, stirring frequently until smooth. Let it cool slightly.

item.title: Chocolate & Banana bar
item.description: Place the banana slices on a board or tray lined with parchment or baking paper. Add the peanut butter, then the nuts (e.g., peanuts, almonds, pistachios,…) on top, and finally the melted chocolate. You can sprinkle some salt or more nuts on top as decoration. Freeze for at least 1 hour. Cut it in pieces. Storage Store in the freezer in an airtight container or plastic bag. It lasts 3 to 4 months!

item.title: Chocolate blood sausage
item.description: Melt the chocolate: In a double boiler or microwave, melt the dark chocolate with the butter, stirring occasionally until smooth. Let it cool slightly. Add the dry ingredients: Stir in the crushed cookies and chopped nuts until everything is well combined. Shape the “morcilla”: Place the mixture on a piece of plastic wrap or parchment paper. Shape it into a log (like a morcilla), wrapping it tightly. Chill: Place the log in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, or until it becomes firm.

item.title: Chocolate Chip "Wonderbread"
item.description: Prepare Batter: In a stand mixer, combine the egg white powder and water. Beat until stiff peaks form. Combine Ingredients: Gently fold in the Greek yogurt, being careful not to overmix. Add the chocolate chips and fold until just combined. Bake: Transfer the batter into an oiled baking tin. Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for about 30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown. Cool and Serve: Allow to cool slightly.

item.title: Chocolate palm heart
item.description: Mix the ground oats with the yogurt using a whisk or blender. Spread the mixture on parchment paper, shaping it into a hearth. Bake for 12 minutes at 180°C (356°F), flipping once halfway through. Melt the chocolate or cocoa powder and cover the pastry. Let it cool and then refrigerate in the fridge. From Instagram @fitfoodmania.

item.title: Cockles ceviche
item.description: You can substitute the can of cockles with a can of clams. Put the contents of the can of cockles in a glass jar, including the liquid. Cut the avocado into cubes and add it to the jar. Slice the onion into thin strips and add it to the jar. Add the rest of the ingredients to the jar. Close the jar and mix it well. Serve in a bowl. From Instagram @fitfoodmania.

item.title: Cold rice cake
item.description: Prepare the Rice Cake Base: In a bowl, crush the puffed rice cakes until you get crumbs (you can use your hands or a fork). If you want a more compact base, you can add a splash of milk or a plant-based drink to slightly moisten the crumbs, helping them compact better. Form the Base: On a plate or in a mold (you can use a dessert ring to shape it), press the crushed rice cake crumbs firmly onto the bottom to create a uniform and compact base for the cake.

item.title: Corn ribs
item.description: Prepare the Corn: Place the raw corn on the cob upright on a cutting board. Using a large, sharp knife, cut the corn lengthwise, splitting it into four “ribs.” Repeat with all the corn cobs. Prepare the Seasoning: In a large bowl, mix the melted butter with the garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Coat the Corn Ribs: Add the corn “ribs” to the bowl and mix them well so they are evenly coated with the butter and spices.

item.title: Cottage cheese & banana cake
item.description: Add all of your ingredients for the Cheesecake into a food processor or blender. Process or blend everything together until smooth. Pour your mix into your Cheesecake dish or pan. Bake on 160°C (325°F) for around 20-25 minutes. Let it cool, wrap it up, and put it into the fridge for a few hours. Adaptation from The Protein Chef.

item.title: Crêpes
item.description: Prepare the Batter: In a bowl, beat the egg with the milk or plant-based drink. Add the salt and sugar and mix well until combined. Add the Flour: Gradually incorporate the flour, whisking as you go. Continue adding flour until the mixture has the consistency of a thin custard—that is, it should be fluid enough to spread easily in the pan. Rest (optional): If you have time, let the batter rest in the refrigerator for about 15-20 minutes.

item.title: Crispy gnocchi
item.description: In a bowl, add the gnocchi, spices, salt, and oil, and mix well. Place the gnocchi in the air fryer. Set the air fryer to 180-200°C (350-400°F) for 15-20 minutes. Halfway through the cooking time, shake the gnocchi to ensure even cooking. From Instagram @fussimonsi.

item.title: Cuban-style rice
item.description: For 2 servings. Cook the rice: In a pot, bring water to a boil, add a pinch of salt, and cook the rice for about 15-20 minutes, or until tender. Drain and set aside. Sauté garlic and rice: In a pan, heat a little olive oil and sauté the minced garlic until fragrant. Add the cooked rice, stir for a few minutes to infuse the garlic flavor, then set aside. Fry the sausages (optional): In the same pan, fry the sausages until browned.

item.title: Currywurst
item.description: Cut the onion into thick julienne slices. Sauté the onions in a pan until they are golden and soft. Cook the sausages in a pan, on the grill, or in the oven until they are fully cooked. For the sauce, combine all the ingredients in a pan and simmer until well-blended. Slice the sausages into bite-sized pieces. Assemble everything together, sprinkle curry powder over the sauce, and garnish with green chili peppers.

item.title: Egg in the basket
item.description: Cut a hole in the bread: Use a round cookie cutter or the rim of a glass to cut a hole in the center of the bread slice (about 5-7 cm in diameter). Keep the hole for later use if you want to toast it separately. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add the butter or oil, allowing it to melt and coat the pan. Place the bread slice in the pan, then crack the egg into the hole in the center of the bread.

item.title: Esquites
item.description: Mix all the ingredients in a glass. From Tako Away.

item.title: Frango Da Guia (Peri Peri Chicken)
item.description: For the Peri Peri sauce (optional) 1-4 peri peri chilies, or as many as you have (adjust the amount based on desired spiciness) 1 teaspoon brown sugar 3 garlic cloves 2 teaspoons sweet/spicy paprika Extra virgin olive oil A bit of fresh ginger Ground black pepper Salt Dried oregano 1 teaspoon soy sauce 40 ml white vinegar (or wine) 2 teaspoons lemon juice Instructions Prepare the chicken: Clean the chicken and cut it into pieces (thighs, breasts, wings, etc.

item.title: Frittata (onion omelette)
item.description: Ingredients for 2 servings. Peel the onions and slice them thinly. In a large pan, add a drizzle of oil, then the onions, cook them for about 10 minutes over medium heat, stirring occasionally until they soften (the onions should be translucent). Beat the eggs in a bowl. Add the grated Parmesan, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of pepper, and mix well. When the onions are completely softened, spread them evenly across the bottom of the pan.

item.title: Galician-style eggs
item.description: For 2 servings. Prepare the cold water: Before starting the recipe, fill a bowl with lukewarm water (from the tap) and place it in the fridge, preferably in the coldest part. If you have ice at home, you can skip this step. Boil the eggs: Bring a pot of water to a boil. Once boiling, add the eggs, salt to taste, and a dash of vinegar (optional) to help peel the eggs more easily later.

item.title: Garlic bread
item.description: Prepare the garlic butter: In a small bowl, mix the softened butter with minced garlic, chopped parsley, and a pinch of salt. If desired, add some grated Parmesan for extra flavor. Slice the bread: Cut the baguette or loaf into slices, making sure not to cut all the way through so the slices stay connected at the bottom. Spread the garlic butter: Using a knife or spoon, spread the garlic butter mixture between each slice and across the top of the bread.

item.title: Garlic mushrooms
item.description: Wash and slice the mushrooms into thick slices. Mix them with garlic, parsley, chili pepper, oil, and salt. Preheat your air fryer. Cook them at 190°C (375°F) for 10 minutes (halfway through cooking, open the air fryer and stir them). Similar recipes: Instagram @misrecetasairfryercosori Instagram @pilpileando_con_guille

item.title: Gnocchi with churros flavor
item.description: Prepare the Gnocchi: Place the gnocchi in a bowl. Add one teaspoon of extra virgin olive oil and mix well so that all the gnocchi are lightly coated. Cook in the Air Fryer: Transfer the gnocchi to the air fryer basket. Cook at 190°C (375°F) for 15 minutes. Halfway through the cooking time (at approximately 7-8 minutes), shake the basket to ensure they cook evenly and become crispy on all sides.

item.title: Gohan (Japanese rice)
item.description: Use round or bomba rice (avoid basmati or long-grain rice). Measure the rice and place it in a pot. Add plenty of water to the pot, stir quickly 2 or 3 times, and then discard the water. Add water again and wash the rice by hand, repeating this process 3-6 times (or until the water runs clear), and discarding the water each time. Add an equal amount of water to the washed rice, cover with a lid, and if you have time, I recommend letting the rice soak for 30 minutes.

item.title: Grandma's Cake
item.description: Prepare the Custard: In a saucepan, pour 1 liter of milk. Set aside one glass of cold milk. Heat the rest of the milk over medium heat. In the glass of cold milk, dissolve the 2 custard mix sachets and sugar to taste. When the milk in the saucepan is hot (without boiling), pour in the mixture from the glass, stirring continuously with a whisk until it thickens. Remove from heat and set aside.

item.title: Homemade Sushi
item.description: Tip: The best rice for making sushi is the Japonica variety, which is short-grain and sticky, and can be found in all Asian stores and many supermarkets. If you don’t have time to buy it, you can also use Bomba rice, which has similar characteristics. Cook the rice and refrigerate it in the fridge. Cover an egg carton with plastic wrap. Place small pieces of salmon in each compartment. Add avocado on top and the cream cheese (optional).

item.title: Horchata and fartons cake
item.description: Mix 400 ml of horchata with the cornstarch and heat over medium heat, stirring constantly until it thickens. Reserve the remaining 200 ml of horchata to soak the fartons. Soak the gelatin sheets in cold water. Drain the gelatin and add it to the thickened horchata cream. Transfer the mixture to a bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let it cool to room temperature. Whip the very cold cream with the powdered sugar until it is semi-whipped (soft peaks).

item.title: Invisible apple cake
item.description: Preparation Peel the apples and slice them very thinly. In a bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, oil, eggs, and milk. Mix until smooth. Gently fold in the apple slices. Grease and flour a baking pan, then pour the batter into the pan. Bake at 180°C (350°F) until golden brown, about 30-40 minutes. Once cooled, dust with powdered sugar or cinnamon for garnish. Information Unsichtbare Apfelkuchen (Invisible Apple Cake) is a unique German dessert that features a large volume of thinly sliced apples combined with just enough light batter to hold the shape of the cake after baking.

item.title: Käsespätzle
item.description: For 1 generous serving. Prepare the Spätzle Dough: In a bowl, mix the flour, salt, and nutmeg. Add the egg and milk. Vigorously beat the mixture with a wooden spoon or hand mixer for 5 minutes. The dough should be thick and sticky, forming air bubbles. Let the dough rest for 15 minutes. Make the Röstzwiebeln (Crispy Onions): Slice the half onion into thin rings. In a frying pan, melt half a tablespoon of butter over medium heat.

item.title: KFC-style chicken nuggets
item.description: Cut the chicken breasts into medium-large cubes or strips and place them in a bowl. Add the oil, yogurt, and spices. Stir and let marinate for 30 minutes. Coat each piece in flour, then in beaten egg, and finally in crushed cornflakes (in that order). Place them on a baking tray lined with baking paper and cook at 180°C (350°F) for 20 minutes, or in an Airfryer. Serve with sauce.

item.title: Khachapuri
item.description: For 1 serving. Prepare the dough: Dissolve the yeast and sugar in warm water. Let it rest for 5-10 minutes until a foam forms. In a separate bowl, mix the flour and salt. Make a well in the center and pour in the yeast mixture and oil. Mix and knead on a floured surface for about 10 minutes until the dough is smooth and elastic. Cover and let it rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.

item.title: Lemon butter sardines
item.description: Prepare the sardines: Clean and fillet the sardines, removing the bones and skin, similar to how anchovies are prepared. Chill them in the refrigerator. Make the lemon butter: In a small bowl, combine the softened butter with lemon juice and zest. Stir until smooth. Toast the bread: Toast the bread slice until golden and crispy. Spread the butter: Spread the lemon butter evenly over the toasted bread. Add the sardines: Place the filleted sardines on top of the buttered toast.

item.title: Lentils donettes
item.description: Quantities for 28 small donuts. Blend all the ingredients. Divide the mixture into a donut mold and bake at 180°C (350°F) for 18 minutes; or for 5 minutes in a donut maker. (Optional) Let cool and decorate with melted dark chocolate mixed with almond pieces. From Instagram @marisel.orozco.

item.title: Loaded fries
item.description: Loaded fries is a dish consisting of French fries topped with a combination of cheese, sauces, meat (commonly bacon) and vegetables. Ingredients for 1 serving. Prepare the fries: Cut the potatos into fries. Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F) or heat the oil in a frying pan. Cook the fries: If baking, toss the fries in a little olive oil and spread them on a baking sheet. Bake for 25-30 minutes, turning halfway through until golden and crispy.

item.title: Malai broccoli
item.description: Prepare the Cashew Paste: Soak the cashews in warm water for 20 minutes until softened. Drain and add them to a blender along with the cold water. Blend until smooth and creamy, forming a thick cashew paste. Set aside. Prepare the Broccoli: Blanch the broccoli florets in boiling salted water for 2 minutes. Transfer immediately to ice water for 2-3 minutes to stop cooking. Drain and gently squeeze out excess water.

item.title: Marry me chicken
item.description: Prepare and Sear the Chicken: Season the chicken thighs (or breasts) with salt and black pepper to taste. Heat 1 tablespoon of extra virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the chicken on both sides until golden brown and cooked through (approximately 6-8 minutes per side, depending on thickness). Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside. Prepare the Sauce Base: In the same skillet, without cleaning it, add 1 more tablespoon of olive oil if needed.

item.title: Mediterranean sandwich
item.description: No instructions required. From Pans & Company.

item.title: Miller's Hole
item.description: Prepare the bread: Cut a thick slice from the loaf of bread. Using a small knife or spoon, create a small hollow or “hole” in the center of the bread slice, leaving a border around the edge. Optional toasting: For a crispy texture, you can toast the bread slice at 180°C (350°F) for about 5 minutes, or until it’s lightly golden. Fill with olives: Place the sliced olives into the hollowed-out area of the bread.

item.title: Mini Chocolate Tartlets
item.description: For 2 small tartlets. Combine the cornflakes with the melted chocolate. Press the mixture firmly into two pre-greased mini tart molds to form the base. Chill in the fridge for 20 minutes. Fill the tarts with peanut butter and sprinkle chopped walnuts on top. Finally, cover with more melted chocolate (use as much as chocolate as needed). Let them cool in the fridge. From Instagram @levartenutricion.

item.title: Mug cake
item.description: For 1 serving. Tips If you use unsalted butter, add 1/8 teaspoon of salt. You can substitute the butter by oil (2-3 teaspoons) or mashed banana. If you want a larger portion, simply double the recipe and cook it in a medium-sized microwave-safe bowl, transforming this receipt in a bowl cake. Preparation In a microwave-safe mug, melt the butter in the microwave for about 20-30 seconds. Mix all the dry ingredients thoroughly until well combined.

item.title: Mushrooms in sauce with egg
item.description: Ingredients for 2 servings. Peel and chop the garlic cloves and sauté them in a pot with a drizzle of oil. Peel and chop the onion, add it to the pot, and let it soften. Season and add the dried chili peppers. Add the flour and cook it. Pour in the wine and add the cleaned and quartered mushrooms. Season and cook for 12-15 minutes. Remove the chili peppers and fill 2 oven-proof ramekins with the mushroom mixture.

item.title: Napoleon cake
item.description: For the cake layers 450 grams of flour 100 grams of sugar 25 grams of butter 3 eggs 1 teaspoon of baking powder A pinch of salt For the custard 700 ml of milk 2 eggs 100 grams of sugar 1 teaspoon of vanilla sugar 3 tablespoons of flour 100 grams of butter Preparation Prepare the cake dough Beat the eggs with the sugar and a pinch of salt in a large bowl using a whisk.

item.title: No-Bake Cheesecake
item.description: Prepare the Base In a blender or food processor, break the cookies into small pieces and blend until finely crushed. Melt the butter and mix it with the crushed cookies. Stir until the mixture resembles wet sand. Line the base of a 20 cm (8-inch) springform pan with parchment paper to prevent sticking. Press the cookie and butter mixture firmly into the bottom of the pan using the back of a spoon to create a compact and even base.

item.title: Non-fried Calamari
item.description: In a bowl, combine the flour (or ground almonds) and salt, and mix well. Add the cleaned and chopped squids, coating them thoroughly in the mixture. Cover the air fryer basket with parchment (baking paper) and arrange the squids evenly in the air fryer basket, and give them a light spray of olive oil. Cook at 180°C (350°F) for 12 minutes in the air fryer, or bake in the oven at 180°C (350°F) for 15 minutes.

item.title: Oat and Chocolate cookies
item.description: You can use wheat flour or any other kind of flour. I even recommend using ground oats as flour, in addition to the oat flakes. Preheat the oven with two baking trays lined with parchment paper. Mix the butter, sugar, and egg in a bowl. Add the remaining ingredients to the mixture except for the chocolate, and mix with a dough utensil until fully combined. Add the chopped chocolate and incorporate it evenly into the dough.

item.title: Oat and Chocolate mousse
item.description: Prepare the base: In a bowl, mix the oats, cocoa powder, chia seeds, and milk. Prepare the mousse: In a separate bowl, blend the cream cheese with the peanut butter and vanilla extract until smooth. Assemble: Spread the mousse mixture over the oat base in the bowl. Add the topping: Drizzle a layer of melted 85% dark chocolate on top. Chill: Place in the freezer for 5 minutes, or refrigerate overnight for best results.

item.title: Oreo ice cream pop
item.description: Crush the cookies: Without opening the Oreo package, crush the cookies inside until they become fine crumbs. Add milk: Open the package slightly and pour in milk until it fills the package. Mix gently by shaking. Insert the stick: Pierce the package with the wooden stick, positioning it in the center. Freeze: Place the package in the freezer and let it freeze completely (about 4-6 hours). Unwrap: Once frozen, carefully remove the Oreo ice cream from the package.

item.title: Outback Blooming Onion
item.description: Prepare the Onion: Keep the root of the onion intact to hold it together. Slice off the top and peel the outer layer. Place the onion face down and cut it into quarters, then quarter it again once or twice more, depending on the size of the onion. Soak in ice water: Let the cut onion sit in ice water for a few minutes. This helps the layers separate and gives the onion a crisp texture.

item.title: Parmesan-wrapped asparagus
item.description: Prepare the Asparagus: Wash the green asparagus and trim off the woody ends. Dry them thoroughly with paper towels. Wrap the Asparagus: Take a slice of serrano ham (or prosciutto) and wrap each asparagus spear from the base to the tip, ensuring it’s held securely. Sauté the Garlic: Peel and finely mince the garlic cloves. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and sauté for 30 seconds, being careful not to burn it.

item.title: Pastel de manzana estilo compota
item.description: For 4 servings. Prepare the Apples: Wash the 4 apples well (do not peel them) and cut them into small cubes. Cook the Apples: In a frying pan or pot, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped apples and cinnamon. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the apples soften and begin to break down, forming a thick compote (about 10-15 minutes). If desired, add the sweetener or sugar at this step.

item.title: Pear upside-down cake
item.description: Bottom: Using 2 pears, place the pear slices along the bottom of the tin spreading them out and covering the entire bottom of the tin. Sponge: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Add the butter, sugar and vanilla extract into a bowl and combine well into a smooth paste like texture. Add in the flour, baking powder, pear purée and mix into a thick smooth batter. Spoon this batter over the pears into your lined tin and spread it out evenly.

item.title: Picadillo soup
item.description: Heat the broth: In a medium pot, bring the chicken broth to a gentle boil over medium heat. Cook the noodles: Add the small pasta noodles to the boiling broth. Stir occasionally and cook for 3-5 minutes, or until tender (refer to the pasta package instructions for exact timing). Add the ham and egg: Stir in the finely chopped serrano ham and diced hard-boiled eggs. Allow them to warm through for 1-2 minutes.

item.title: Pilpil prawns
item.description: Peel the prawns or shrimp and set them aside. Heat the oil over medium heat. Peel the garlic cloves and slice them thinly. Lower the heat and add the garlic and cayenne peppers, frying until the garlic is golden brown. Remove the pan from the heat and add a teaspoon of paprika, stirring to prevent it from burning. Add the prawns and let them cook in the residual heat. If using shrimp, cook for an additional minute or two over the heat until they change color.

item.title: Piquillo peppers
item.description: Prepare the Garlic and Parsley: Finely mince the garlic and chop the parsley. Assemble the Peppers: Place the drained piquillo peppers on a serving plate. Season: Sprinkle the minced garlic and chopped parsley evenly over the peppers. Dress with Olive Oil: Drizzle the olive oil generously over the peppers, making sure each pepper is coated. Add salt to taste. Marinate and Serve: Let the peppers sit for about 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to blend.

item.title: Pizza toast
item.description: Prepare the Bread: If you wish, lightly toast the slices of sandwich bread in a toaster or air fryer for 1-2 minutes. This will prevent them from getting too soggy with the toppings. Assemble the Toast-Pizza: On each slice of bread, spread a thin layer of tomato sauce. Add the Toppings: Place your favorite extra toppings over the tomato sauce. Cover with Cheese: Sprinkle a generous amount of grated mozzarella cheese over the toppings.

item.title: Porridge
item.description: To make on the hob Add all ingredients to a large saucepan and stir together. Bring to a simmer over a low-medium heat. Continue to simmer, stirring frequently, for another 5-7 minutes until the oats have softened and the porridge is creamy. To make in the microwave: Add all ingredients to a microwave safe bowl and stir. Microwave for 2 minutes, stir, then microwave for another 1 minute and 30 seconds.

item.title: Quail with majao
item.description: Make the majao (garlic paste): In a mortar, crush the garlic with a pinch of salt until you form a smooth paste. Optionally add the paprika and mix well. Prepare the quails: Clean the quails and season them with salt and pepper. If you prefer, you can marinate them with the majao for an hour or two to enhance the flavor. Cook the quails: Heat a good amount of olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat.

item.title: Quesadilla
item.description: As the main ingredient, you can use your favourite protein (chicken, turkey, tuna, salmon, etc.). Place one tortilla in the air fryer. Cover with the main ingredient (e.g., chicken) and half of the cheese, spreading them evenly. Cover with the second tortilla. Place a metal rack on top to prevent the tortilla from flying off. Set the air fryer to 190°C (375°F) for 6 minutes. Halfway through, remove the rack, flip the quesadilla, cover with the remaining shredded cheese, and sprinkle with oregano.

item.title: Rattlesnake Tails
item.description: Preheat your smoker to 275°F (135°C). Score the hot dogs vertically and horizontally to give them a rattlesnake tail appearance. Slather the hot dogs with mustard to act as a binder for the seasoning. In a small bowl, mix together the smoked paprika, onion powder, garlic powder, and ground dried chiles. Coat the mustard-covered hot dogs thoroughly with the seasoning mix. Place the hot dogs on the smoker for about 20 minutes, allowing the cuts to open up.

item.title: Salmon rillettes
item.description: For 6 servings. You can also make the dish entirely with fresh salmon or entirely with smoked salmon by cooking half of it. Season the salmon on both sides lightly with a bit of salt. Steam in a steamer basket until just cooked, about 8 minutes. Once cooked, remove from heat and let cool. In a medium-sized bowl, mash together with a fork the butter and the olive oil until very smooth.

item.title: Salmon Tataki
item.description: For 2 servings. Safety Preparation: Ensure the salmon loin has been previously frozen (minimum 48 hours at -20°C) for food safety, as it will be consumed almost raw. Prepare the Marinade: In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, lemon or lime juice, grated fresh ginger, and toasted sesame oil (if using). Marinate the Salmon: Submerge the clean salmon loin in the marinade. Let it marinate in the refrigerator for a maximum of 15 to 30 minutes.

item.title: Scrambled eggs
item.description: Crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk them well until the yolks and whites are fully blended. Add a pinch of salt and pepper, and if desired, a splash of milk or cream for a creamier texture. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-low heat and add the butter or oil. Let it melt, coating the pan evenly. Pour the eggs into the pan once the butter is melted and starts to foam.

item.title: Sevillian-style spinach with chickpeas
item.description: Prepare the Spinach: If using fresh spinach, wash and blanch it briefly in boiling water, then drain. If using frozen spinach, thaw and drain well. Toast the Garlic: Heat a skillet over medium heat with olive oil. Fry the garlic cloves until golden but not burnt. Cook the Spinach and Chickpeas: In the skillet, add a bit more olive oil if necessary. Add the spinach and chickpeas and sauté for a few minutes.

item.title: Sharlotka
item.description: Preheat the oven to 350°F/180°C. Line a 9x3 round cake pan or springform pan with parchment paper. Butter or spray both the paper, and the sides of the pan. Peel and core the apples. Chop in quarters, then slice into thin, bite size pieces. Place the apples into the buttered cake pan. Using a mixer, beat the eggs and sugar in a bowl until the sugar dissolves (around 5 minutes).

item.title: Shoyu Ramen
item.description: Prepare the Broth (Dashi and Bone Broth): Clean and blanch the chicken/pork bones in boiling water for 5 minutes to remove impurities. Rinse them and place them in a large pot with 3-4 liters of cold water. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to a minimum. Add the scallions, ginger, and garlic cloves. Simmer for a minimum of 3-4 hours (the longer, the more flavor). Remove the bones and vegetables.

item.title: Soft quark drop and fruit cake
item.description: Mix the flour, and baking powder and set aside. Beat two eggs, sugar, and vanilla for 2-3 minutes until light and fluffy. Pour in the oil and milk, then mix well. Add the flour mixture and stir until combined. Grease a baking tray (30x40 cm), spread the batter evenly, and add the fruits on top. In a separate bowl, mix the quark, sugar, and an egg until smooth. Use a spoon to distribute this mixture over the cake.

item.title: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
item.description: Cook the spaghetti: Bring a large stockpot of generously-salted water to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook until nearly al dente (like, just one minute shy of being done). Sauté the garlic: Meanwhile, about 3 minutes after you add the pasta to the boiling water, heat the olive oil in a large sauté pan over medium heat. Add the sliced garlic and crushed red pepper flakes and sauté for 3 to 5 minutes, or until it is lightly golden.

item.title: Spanakopita (Spinach and feta pie)
item.description: Prepare the filling: In a large pan, sauté the spinach over medium heat until wilted (skip this step if using thawed frozen spinach). Allow it to cool slightly, then squeeze out excess liquid. In a mixing bowl, combine the spinach, feta cheese, spring onions, eggs, dill, parsley, mint nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Mix well until evenly combined. Layer the phyllo pastry: Preheat the oven to 180°C. Lightly grease a rectangular baking dish (approximately 23x33 cm).

item.title: Spanish omelette
item.description: For 4 servings. Peel and slice the potatoes into thin, even slices. If using onion, peel and finely chop it. Heat olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the potatoes (and onion, if using) and cook gently. Stir occasionally until the potatoes are soft but not crispy (15-20 minutes). Remove the potatoes (and onion) with a slotted spoon and drain excess oil. Beat the eggs in a large bowl and season with salt.

item.title: Spicy beef noodles
item.description: Cook the Noodles: Cook the noodles until al dente. Before draining them, reserve a little of the noodle water. Prepare the Sauce: In a bowl, combine the peanut butter, soy sauce, sugar, minced garlic, Sichuan pepper powder, and sriracha. Add a splash of the reserved noodle water and mix well until the sauce is smooth. Brown the Beef: Heat a little oil in your pan. Add the ground beef and brown it for about 3 minutes over medium-high heat.

item.title: Spinach Wraps
item.description: Chop the spinach into very small pieces. Mix the spinach with the rest of the ingredients. Heat a pan with a few drops of olive oil. Spoon a bit of the mixture onto the pan and shape it into a round form with the back of a spoon. Cook on both sides until golden brown. You can fill them with your favourite toppings (e.g., cucumber, arugula, smoked salmon, and light mayonnaise).

item.title: Spring bread
item.description: Toast the bread with the olive oil. Put the ingredients on top. To improve the receipt, you can use bread from pizza dough. You can also replace the tomato with cherry tomatoes. From Pizzeria Primavera.

item.title: Stir-fried French beans with dry chili (Gān Biān Dòu Jiǎo)
item.description: Prepare the Green Beans: Wash the green beans thoroughly and snap off the ends. If they are very long, you can cut them in half or into 2-3 inch pieces. It’s crucial to dry them very well with paper towels; this is key to ensuring they brown nicely and don’t steam. Cook the Green Beans (“Dry-Frying” Method): Heat a wok over medium-high heat. Add 2-3 tablespoons of vegetable oil. Once the oil is hot (but not smoking), add the dried green beans.

item.title: Stuffed Focaccia Sandwich
item.description: Toast the focaccia at 180°C (350°F) for 10-12 minutes (fan-assisted). Slice the focaccia in half horizontally (this can be done before or after toasting). Optionally, drizzle extra virgin olive oil on both halves. Layer slices of mortadella on one half of the focaccia until it’s fully covered. Cut the burrata and spread it evenly over the mortadella. Spread a layer of pesto on top of the burrata. Close the focaccia with the other half.

item.title: Stuffed mushrooms with garlic and parsley
item.description: Remove the stems and thoroughly wash the mushrooms to eliminate any dirt or sand. It’s important not to remove the skin in this case, as they could burn (especially if cooked in a pan). Take a handful of parsley and as many garlic cloves as you think necessary, depending on how many mushrooms you want to prepare. Finely chop the garlic and parsley, and let them marinate with a good drizzle of olive oil.

item.title: Stuffed peppers
item.description: Preheat your oven to 220°C (425°F) and bring a pot of water (enough to cover the bell peppers) to a boil. Wash the bell peppers, cut off the tops, and scoop out the insides. If needed, slice a small part off the bottom of the peppers so they will stand upright. (NOTE: Chop the extra bell pepper tops to cook later with the onion - discard the stem.) Blanch the bell peppers for 5 minutes to slightly soften.

item.title: Super banana cookie
item.description: Mix Ingredients: In a bowl, mash the banana until smooth. Add the egg, oat flour, vanilla extract, and cocoa powder. Stir until you have a smooth, thick batter. Shape the Cookie: Form a large cookie shape with the batter, or divide it into smaller portions if you prefer multiple cookies. Place parchment paper in the air fryer basket to prevent sticking. Cook in the Air Fryer: Preheat the air fryer to 180°C (350°F).

item.title: Super Mexican pizza
item.description: Preheat the oven: Preheat to 220°C (430°F) or follow the pizza dough package instructions. Place a pizza stone or baking sheet in the oven to heat up. Prepare the base: Roll out the pizza dough to your desired thickness and place it on a sheet of parchment paper for easy handling. Spread an even layer of tomato sauce over the dough. Add toppings: Sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese evenly over the base.

item.title: Taco burger
item.description: Place the burger patty on the wheat tortilla and press it down well so that it almost covers the tortilla and sticks to it. Fry the egg on a griddle or in a pan. Cook the burger on the griddle with the tortilla facing down. Flip it over and add a slice of your favorite cheese and cover with a lid to melt the cheese. Add your favorite sauce (BBQ, mustard, ketchup,…), and finally, place the fried egg on top.

item.title: Tiramisu
item.description: Prepare the Sponge Cake: In a bowl, mix the egg, yogurt, oat flour, baking powder, and sweetener until smooth. Lightly grease a small microwave-safe dish or mug and pour in the batter. Microwave on high for 3 minutes, checking after 2 minutes and adding 15-second intervals if needed until cooked. Let the sponge cake cool for a few minutes, then slice it into thin layers. Soak the Layers: Dip each sponge layer in cooled coffee (and optional liquor such as brandy or cognac), letting it absorb slightly without getting too soggy.

item.title: Tuna pâté
item.description: Drain the oil or water from the canned tuna using a strainer. Mash the tuna with a fork until it starts to form a paste. Peel and finely chop the shallot into very small pieces, almost unnoticeable. Finely chop the capers (optional) and parsley as well. In a bowl, mix the tuna with the lemon juice. Add the shallot, capers, parsley, mayonnaise, ketchup, and mustard (optional). Adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper.

item.title: Tzatziki
item.description: Prepare the cucumber: Grate the cucumber and place it in a cheesecloth or a clean kitchen towel. Squeeze out as much liquid as possible to prevent the sauce from becoming watery. Mix the ingredients: In a medium bowl, combine the yogurt, grated cucumber, garlic powder, onion powder, dill, parsley, olive oil, and lemon juice. Stir well until all ingredients are fully blended. Season and chill: Add salt to taste, along with pepper if desired.

item.title: Yogurt banana cake
item.description: Mash the bananas: In a bowl, mash the bananas until smooth. Mix ingredients: Add the yogurt, eggs, and sweetener or vanilla extract. Mix until well combined. Preheat the oven or Air-Fryer: Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F). Prepare the pan: Grease a cake pan or line it with parchment paper. Pour the mixture: Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top. Bake: Bake in the oven for 50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

item.title: Yukihira style shalyapin steak don
item.description: To prepare the rice bowl, follow the Gohan recipe. How to cook Chop the onions finely. (Optional) Chop the garlic and mix with the onion. Remove the tendons from the beef and beat it with a meat tenderizer until as flat as possible. Cover meat on both sides with the chopped onion and leave for 30 minutes or more. Remove the onion and add salt and pepper to the steak. Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a frying pan, and fry the onion until it changes color.

item.title: Zah Zah shake
item.description: 1 serving. Prepare a shake with the milk, sugar (optional), avocado, and banana. Once blended, pour it into a 1/2-liter jug. Add a flan and decorate with diced peach, banana slices, quartered strawberries, ground almonds, walnuts, and the syrups (optional). Adaptation from Cocina de Ceuta.

item.title: Zucchini Scarpaccia
item.description: Slice the zucchinis into thin rounds using a mandoline or a knife. Thinly slice the onion into julienne strips. Place the zucchinis and onion in a colander over a deep plate or bowl. Add salt, mix well, and let it sit for at least two hours with some weight on top. Preheat the oven to 220°C (428°F). In a large bowl, add the flour and the liquid released by the zucchinis, one tablespoon of olive oil, black pepper, and Parmesan cheese if desired.
